author: trackreco
body:
### PR description:
This PR introduces a configurable cut on the max hit cluster size (by default < 8) for SiStrip hits in mkFit iterations.
Hits that do not pass such cut are not added to the track nor counted as missing hits in candidate scoring.
This is to be considered as parallel/independent wrt. PR #34618.
Rejecting large clusters allows for a significant reduction of fake tracks, with ~ zero change in efficiency.

### PR validation:
TTbar + PU: http://uaf-10.t2.ucsd.edu/~mmasciov/MIC/maxClusterSize/MTV_TTbarPU50_maxClusterSize7_fakeHitIdx-5
High-pT (1800-2400 GeV) QCD + PU: http://uaf-10.t2.ucsd.edu/~mmasciov/MIC/maxClusterSize/MTV_highPtQCD_wPU_maxClusterSize7_fakeHitIdx-5

Note that the performance in high-pT QCD MC was also evaluated following a report at one past TRK POG meeting, and no regression is visible (see comparisons above).

### Additional notes:
This PR will need a `git rebase` after #37581 and #37586; however, I'm opening it already in favor of starting its review already, since the review will be independent of the rebase.

FYI @mmusich @vmariani
title: Add configurable cut on SiStrip max cluster cut (by default <8) in mkFit tracking iterations
